antivirusEngine.title: Antivirus engine
antivirusEngine.description: Properties displayed below will be managed, a user would not be able to override them

enableRealTimeProtection.description: Locates and stops malware from installing or running on your device. You can turn off this setting for a short time before it turns back on automatically.
enableRealTimeProtection.title: Real-time protection

exclusions.description: Entities that have been excluded from the scan. Exclusions can be specified by full paths, extensions, or file names.

isDirectory.title: Is directory
isDirectory.description: Directory if selected, or file if not selected

name.title: Process name
name.description: Process name, either or full path or file name, wildcards supported

path.title: Path
path.description: Path to exclude, wildcards are supported

exclusions.title: Scan exclusions

passiveMode.description: Whether the antivirus engine runs in passive mode or not.
passiveMode.title: Passive mode

allowedThreats.description: List of threats (identified by their name) that are not blocked by the product and are instead allowed to run.
allowedThreats.title: Allowed threats

threatTypeSettings.description: The threatTypeSettings preference in the antivirus engine is used to control how certain threat types are handled by the product.
threatTypeSettings.title: Threat type settings

key.title: Threat type
key.description: Type of the threat for which the behavior is configured.

value.title: Action to take
value.description: Action to take when coming across a threat of the type specified in the preceding section.

exclusionsMergePolicy.title: Exclusions merge
exclusionsMergePolicy.description: Specify the merge policy for exclusions. This can be a combination of administrator-defined and user-defined exclusions (merge) or only administrator-defined exclusions (admin_only). This setting can be used to restrict local users from defining their own exclusions.

disallowedThreatActions.description: Restricts the actions that the local user of a device can take when threats are detected. The actions included in this list are not displayed in the user interface. Use unique values.
disallowedThreatActions.title: Disallowed threat actions

threatTypeSettingsMergePolicy.title: Threat type settings merge
threatTypeSettingsMergePolicy.description: Specify the merge policy for threat type settings. This can be a combination of administrator-defined and user-defined settings (merge) or only administrator-defined settings (admin_only). This setting can be used to restrict local users from defining their own settings for different threat types.

scanResultsRetentionDays.title: Scan results retention
scanResultsRetentionDays.description: Specify the number of days that results are retained in the scan history on the device. Old scan results are removed from the history. Old quarantined files that are also removed from the disk.

scanHistoryMaximumItems.title: Scan history size
scanHistoryMaximumItems.description: Specify the maximum number of entries to keep in the scan history. Entries include all on-demand scans performed in the past and all antivirus detections.

scanAfterDefinitionUpdate.title: Run a scan after definitions are updated
scanAfterDefinitionUpdate.description: Specifies whether to start a process scan after new security intelligence updates are downloaded on the device. Enabling this setting will trigger an antivirus scan on the running processes of the device.

maximumOnDemandScanThreads.title: Degree of parallelism for on-demand scans
maximumOnDemandScanThreads.description: Specifies the degree of parallelism for on-demand scans. This corresponds to the number of threads used to perform the scan and impacts the CPU usage, as well as the duration of the on-demand scan.

scanArchives.title: Scanning inside archive files
scanArchives.description: If true, Defender will unpack archives and scan files inside them. Otherwise archive content will be skipped, that will improve scanning performance.

enableFileHashComputation.title: Enable file hash computation
enableFileHashComputation.description: Enables or disables file hash computation feature. When this feature is enabled Defender will compute hashes for files it scans. This will help in improving the accuracy of Custom Indicator matches. However, enabling EnableFileHashComputation may impact device performance.

offlineDefinitionUpdate.title: Enable offline security intelligence updates
offlineDefinitionUpdate.description: Enables or disables offline security intelligence updates feature. When this feature is enabled Defender will use a local mirror server to update the signatures.

offlineDefinitionUpdateUrl.title: URL for a security intelligence updates mirror server
offlineDefinitionUpdateUrl.description: Sets the URL for a local offline security intelligence updates mirror server. When the feature is enabled Defender will use it to update the signatures.

enabled.description: Provides increased, faster protection with access to the latest protection data in the cloud. Works best with automatic sample submission turned on
enabled.title: Cloud delivered protection

diagnosticLevel.title: Diagnostic data collection
diagnosticLevel.description: We encourage you to share your diagnostic and usage data with us to help improve Microsoft products and services.

automaticSampleSubmissionConsent.title: Automatic sample submission Consent
automaticSampleSubmissionConsent.description: Sends sample files to Microsoft to help protect device users and your organization from potential threats

automaticDefinitionUpdateEnabled.title: Automatic security intelligence updates
automaticDefinitionUpdateEnabled.description: Determines whether security intelligence updates are installed automatically:

cloudBlockLevel.title: Cloud Block Level
cloudBlockLevel.description: Determines how aggressive Defender for Endpoint will be in blocking and scanning suspicious files.

definitionUpdateDue.title: Security intelligence update due (in days)
definitionUpdateDue.description: Determines the number of days after which the last installed security intelligence updates are considered outdated.

definitionUpdatesInterval.title: Security intelligence update interval (in seconds)
definitionUpdatesInterval.description: Specifies the time interval (in seconds) after which security intelligence updates will be checked.

proxy.title: Set proxy for MDE communication
proxy.description: Configure proxy for all MDE cloud communication. If not set, the system-wide proxy is used.

hideStatusMenuIcon.description: Whether the status menu icon (shown in the top-right corner of the screen) is hidden or not.
hideStatusMenuIcon.title: Hide status menu icon

userInitiatedFeedback.title: User initiated feedback
userInitiatedFeedback.description: Specify whether users can submit feedback to Microsoft by going to Help > Send Feedback.

consumerExperience.title: Control sign-in to consumer version
consumerExperience.description: Specify whether users can sign into the consumer version of Microsoft Defender

dataLossPrevention.title: Use Data Loss Prevention
dataLossPrevention.description: Whether data loss prevention enforcement is enabled on the machine.

scheduledScan.title: Scheduled Scan
scheduledScan.description: Schedule scans with Microsoft Defender for Endpoint.

behaviorMonitoring.title: Behavior Monitoring
behaviorMonitoring.description: Behavior Monitoring detections with Microsoft Defender for Endpoint.

offlineDefinitionUpdateVerifySig.title: offline security intelligence updates signature verification
offlineDefinitionUpdateVerifySig.description: Offline security intelligence updates signature verification with Microsoft Defender for Endpoint. It is recommended to keep this setting enabled when offline updates are enabled.

enforcementLevel.title: Enforcement level
enforcementLevel.description: Specifies if tamper protection is disabled, in audit mode, or enforced

exclusions.title: Process exclusions
exclusions.description: Defines process that can interfere with Defender without considering it tampering

path.title: Process path
path.description: Full and exact path to the process binary

policy.title: Device Control Policy
policy.description: JSON string representing the device control policy

enforcementLevel.description: Specifies if network protection is disabled, in audit mode, or enforced
enforcementLevel.title: Enforcement level

disableDnsOverTcpParsing.description: Disables parsing of DNS over TCP
disableDnsOverTcpParsing.title: Disable DNS over TCP parsing

signingId.title: Signing ID
signingId.description: The signing id of the application to exclude from data loss prevention.

flag.title: Flag
flag.description: Bit flags to control the type of exclusion(s) to apply.  EPS=0x1, AX=0x2.

name.title: Feature Name
name.description: The name of a DLP feature to enable or disable.

state.title: State
state.description: Enable a feature up to a deployment ring (default production), or force disable a feature for all rings.

ring.title: Release Ring
ring.description: Limit enabling the feature to a specific deployment ring.

checkForDefinitionsUpdate.title: Check for definitions update
checkForDefinitionsUpdate.description: Check for definitions update before initiating a scheduled scan

dailyConfiguration.title: Daily and Hourly quick scan configuration
dailyConfiguration.description: Check for definitions update before initiating a scheduled scan

timeOfDay.title: Time of day
timeOfDay.description: Specifies the time of day, as the number of minutes after midnight, to perform a daily quick scan.

interval.title: Start time
interval.description: Specify how many hours should elapse before the next hourly quick scan. 0 indicates no hourly quick scan. 1 indicates a scan every hour. 24 indicates a scan once a day.

ignoreExclusions.title: Ignore exclusions
ignoreExclusions.description: Should exclusions be ignored during a scheduled scan

lowPriorityScheduledScan.title: Low priority scheduled scan
lowPriorityScheduledScan.description: Should scheduled scan be run with low priority. (Scan might take longer to complete).

randomizeScanStartTime.title: Randomize scheduled scan start time
randomizeScanStartTime.description: Randomize the start time of a daily and weekly scheduled scan to any interval from 0 to 23 hours.

runScanWhenIdle.title: Run scheduled scan when idle
runScanWhenIdle.description: Run scheduled scan when the device is idle. Only applicable for weekly full scans.

weeklyConfiguration.title: Weekly scheduled scan configuration
weeklyConfiguration.description: Should scheduled scan be run with low priority. (Scan might take longer to complete).

scanType.title: Scan type
scanType.description: Specifies the type of scan to perform.

dayOfWeek.title: Day of week
dayOfWeek.description: Specifies the day of the week to perform a weekly scan. 0 indicates never. 1-7 indicates Sunday - Saturday. 8 indicates every day.

timeOfDay.title: Time of day
timeOfDay.description: Specifies the time of day, as the number of minutes after midnight, to perform a weekly scan.
